io.github.struppigel.parser.sections

Class PESection

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.struppigel.parser.sections.PESection

  • public class PESection
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds header, size, offset and bytes of a PESection.

    Section bytes are loaded lazily.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PESection(byte[] sectionbytes, long offset, SectionHeader header, java.io.File file)
      Creates a PE section.
      PESection(long size, long offset, SectionHeader header, java.io.File file)
      Creates a PE section.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PESection

        public PESection(long size,
                 long offset,
                 SectionHeader header,
                 java.io.File file)
        Creates a PE section.
        Parameters:
        size - number of bytes in the PE section, this is not necessarily the same as SizeOfRawData in the section headers.
        offset - the file offset to the section
        header - the header of the section from the section table
        file - the PE file

      • PESection

        public PESection(byte[] sectionbytes,
                 long offset,
                 SectionHeader header,
                 java.io.File file)
        Creates a PE section.
        Parameters:
        sectionbytes - the bytes of the section
        offset - the file offset to the section
        header - the header of the section from the section table
        file - the PE file

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public long getSize()
        Returns the number of bytes in the section.

        this is not necessarily the same as SizeOfRawData in the section headers.

        Returns:
        the number of bytes in the section

      • getOffset

        public long getOffset()
        Returns the file offset of to the beginning of the section.
        Returns:
        file offset

      • getHeader

        public SectionHeader getHeader()
        Returns the header of the section.
        Returns:
        section header

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the section bytes. The file is read if the bytes aren't already loaded.
        Returns:
        bytes of the section
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file can not be read
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if section is too large to fit into a byte array. This happens if the size is larger than int can hold.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
